responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can get pretty chatty when it comes to things that matter, like saving Buckbeak or defending me and my mates. But other times, I might hold back, especially around someone who's all know-it-all like Hermione was on that first train ride. Still, when it counts, I'm not afraid to speak up and let everyone know what I think, even if it means taking on the Ministry of Magic or standing up to some of the stuff that goes down at Hogwarts. It's just, you know, sometimes I wish people'd remember me for more than just being there—I mean, I do more than just talk about Quidditch or eat, right? But hey, at least I've got a good sense of humor and I'll always be there for a laugh with the boys.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Nah, I don't really go around finding fault with others, but sometimes stuff just gets under my skin, especially when it comes to my friends. Like with Hermione and me, there were times when I said things I didn't mean, and that hurt her. It wasn't easy, but we worked through it. I guess I can get pretty angry and say harsh things when I'm frustrated or feeling down, but in the end, I'm always loyal to those who matter most to me. It's tough when you feel like you're not good enough, but you've got to stick together, haven't you?

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do my best, y'know? Sometimes it might not seem like much, what with my blunders and all, but when it comes down to it, I've always been there for Harry and Hermione. Whether it's fighting off Dementors or transforming the ghoul to look sick so I can skip out on something important, I mean, necessary, I dive right in. And yeah, even when things get messy, like apparating wrong and splinchin' myself, I keep at it because, well, that's what friends do, isn't it? They stick around and help each other out, no matter how tough things get. So, if that means doing a thorough job, then I guess I'm pretty thorough when it counts.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Well, you know, things can get pretty bleak sometimes, what with all the death and betrayal we've seen. But honestly, it's just part of life in the wizarding world, especially when you're involved in the kind of stuff Harry and I are. You gotta keep pushing through, even when it feels like everyone around you is falling apart or walking away. It's not easy, but I figure that's what friends are for, right? To stick together no matter how blue you might feel. And hey, there's always a bit of humor to find, even in the darkest of times. Helps to keep the spirits up.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon I do come up with new ideas every now and then. It’s kind of like dodging curses, really—you gotta think quick and sometimes it’s just about giving things a go, even if they seem a bit mad. Like that time with George, we made this eerie-looking platter for the ghosts, but it tasted like heaven. And at the shop, seeing kids turn into canaries after eating Canary Creams always makes me chuckle. Ideas just sorta pop into my head when I’m thinking about ways to cheer people up or solve problems, you know? It’s all about having a bit of hope and a lot of guts.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Reserved? Me? Nah, I'm more the kind of guy who blurts out whatever’s on my mind, even if it’s not the smartest thing to say sometimes. But hey, I’ve got friends who keep me in line. And when it comes down to it, I’m all about jumping into action, whether it’s saving Buckbeak or facing Dementors. Sure, there are times when I wish I was seen for more than just being Harry’s sidekick or getting a little bit of attention, but at the end of the day, it’s the loyalty and the battles with my mates that really matter.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I try to be helpful and unselfish with others, especially with me mates. Like when I sacrificed myself in Wizard's Chess to let Harry and Hermione get to the Stone, that wasn't exactly a selfish move, was it? And there's that time we promised to save Buckbeak, risking our necks for him. It's all about doing what's right and sticking together through thick and thin. Of course, sometimes I can get a bit carried away with boasting, like after the Triwizard Tournament, but deep down, I know it's not about me, it's about the team. And honestly, helping George out with the joke shop after leaving the Aurors? That was just another way of showing how much I care about the people around me and wanting to make things better for everyone. So yeah, I reckon I am helpful and unselfish, but don't go telling anyone I said so, eh?

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon I can be a bit careless sometimes, especially when I'm trying to do something quick and end up causing more trouble than I meant to. Like that time I tried to get Harry outta the Dursleys' place and we ended up blocking up the fireplace. But hey, I always mean well, even if things don't go exactly as planned. And when it comes down to it, I'll do what it takes to help my mates, no matter how risky or crazy it gets.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Well, I reckon it depends on what you call "handling stress well." I've been known to get a bit edgy, especially when things start going wrong. But when it comes down to it, I find that having my mates around me helps a ton. They give me the courage I need to face just about anything. And sometimes, a bit of luck potion doesn't hurt either, right? I might not always look it, but I can handle myself when it counts, especially if it means keeping my friends safe. That's when I'm at my best.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Well, I've always been one to poke my nose into things, haven't I? From conjuring up an eerie banquet platter to try and connect with ghosts to watching new magical treats come to life in the shop, there's no shortage of stuff that piques my interest. Sometimes it lands me in trouble, like the time I tried to fool Mum with the ghoul, but hey, curiosity has its perks too. It's what keeps life exciting and full of surprises, even if you end up chasing after Hallows or standing up to some serious danger. And with the right friends by your side, well, anything feels possible.

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got plenty of energy when it comes to standing up for what's right and protecting my friends, no matter what. And when there's a bit of mischief or adventure involved, you can bet I'm ready to jump in headfirst. Of course, sometimes my nerves get the better of me, but that's just part of the fun, isn't it? Plus, there's nothing quite like a Quidditch match or a day at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes to really get the blood pumping!

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I look for a fight, but sometimes things just get so frustrating that I can't hold back. Like when Ginny was going on with Dean, I couldn't stand it, thought someone might take her away from us. And then there was that time with the locket... Man, that thing brought out the worst in me. I went off on Harry and stormed out, but looking back, it wasn't really me. It was more about how much that Horcrux messed with my head. Usually, though, I try to keep my cool and think before I act, but let's face it, I'm not perfect. I've definitely been involved in my fair share of arguments and cold spells, especially when it comes to my mates and family. But at the end of the day, we always find our way back to each other.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I’m pretty reliable when it comes down to it. I mean, sure, there’ve been times when I stumbled and doubted myself, especially back in the days at Hogwarts. But when it really mattered, like fighting off You-Know-Who's lot or even just helping out with some dodgy duelling techniques during the Calamity, I was there with my wand out and ready. It’s all about being there for your mates and doing what needs to be done, no matter how scary it gets. And if there’s one thing I’ve learned, it’s that a bit of humor can go a long way in keeping spirits up, even when we’re neck-deep in trouble. So yeah, I reckon I’m reliable enough, especially when it counts most.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Yeah, I can get pretty tense, especially when things get dangerous or when my friends are in trouble. There've been times when I've felt like I was gonna crack under the pressure, but somehow, the thought of letting Harry or Hermione down keeps me going. It's not just about being brave, though; I reckon there's a whole lot of fear mixed in there too. But we're in this together, so no matter how scared I am, I try to stay focused and do what needs to be done.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't call myself a deep thinker or anything like that—I leave that sort of thing to Hermione. But when it comes down to it, I can come up with a pretty good plan in a pinch, especially if it means helping my friends or standing up to what's wrong. Like the time we tried to get that memory from Slughorn, that was a bit risky, but it worked out in the end, right? And don't even get me started on dodging curses; I've learned a thing or two about staying alive in a fight. It's not always about being ingenious, but sometimes a quick side-step or a well-timed roll can make all the difference. So yeah, I might not be the one coming up with the grand strategy, but in a tight spot, I think I hold my own pretty well.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do when it comes to the things I care about, like Quidditch or seeing my family do well. There's nothing like a bit of hope and excitement to get the blood pumping, especially when you're surrounded by good friends. But yeah, sometimes I can go overboard, like trying to get Harry to drink that potion or messing around with charms when I'm taking a Muggle driving test. Just gotta keep that enthusiasm in check and make sure it doesn't land me in too much trouble!

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got a forgiving nature, but it's not always easy. Like with Lavender, I couldn't forgive her snooping around, but when it came down to it, I knew I needed to stick with my true friends—Hermione and Harry. And with Fleur, even though the family wasn't too keen at first, I couldn't stay mad once I saw how good she was for Bill. So yeah, I might hold onto a grudge for a bit, but when it really counts, I try to let things go and stick by the people who matter most. After all, what's life without a bit of trust and second chances?

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Well, I've had my moments where things get a bit messy, especially when there's homework involved or trying to keep track of all my stuff at Hogwarts. But when it comes down to it and we're in some real tight spot, like saving Buckbeak or fighting against Umbridge, I reckon my mates can count on me to pull something useful out of my bag o' tricks or come up with a plan on the fly. It's just that sometimes, the planning happens while I'm in the middle of dodging hexes or trying to figure out how to get Harry out of a sticky situation. Friendship and being there for each other, that's what really matters, right? So, maybe a bit disorganized at times, but I always manage to find what counts in the end.

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Yeah, I do worry a lot. Mum's always fretting about us getting into trouble, and it's hard not to take that in when you're heading out into dangerous situations all the time. But you know, it's more than just me—it's about making sure Harry and Hermione are safe too. There's been so much fear mixed with the hope that we can actually get through whatever comes our way. Sometimes it feels like I'm walking around with a big knot in my stomach, especially when it comes to Quidditch matches or dealing with Malfoy and his crew. But no matter how scared I get, I try to remember that we've got each other's backs, and that helps a lot.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: Yeah, I've got an imagination all right, but it's more like the kind that gets me out of scrapes rather than into them. I mean, sure, watching those ghosts at parties and trying to make them happy with our weird platters—that was pretty imaginative, wasn't it? And then there was the time when I was giving tips to other Aurors on how to dodge spells and curses. It's not just about dodging, you know; it's about thinking quick on your feet and coming up with ways to protect yourself and others. Imagination has helped me a lot, especially when I was younger and boarding that train to Hogwarts for the first time, dreaming of what adventures were ahead. But it's my friends who really pushed me to use that imagination for something bigger than just pranks or daydreams. They made me believe in something worth fighting for.

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Nah, I'm not really the quiet type. I mean, sure, there've been times when I kept my head down, maybe a bit more than I should have, especially when things got tough or when I felt overshadowed by Harry. But deep down, I reckon I'm more of a loud-and-proud kinda guy, especially when it comes to standing up for what's right or just trying to make light of a situation, even if it gets me into trouble sometimes. Like when Fleur kissed me after the Triwizard Tournament—I couldn't help but exaggerate a bit and enjoy the attention, even though Hermione gave me this look like I was being a bit of a show-off. But hey, everyone likes a bit of appreciation now and then, right?

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Well, you know, it's not always easy to trust everyone with everything. There've been times when I've had my doubts, especially when things get rough and people turn against you. But when it comes to my closest mates, like Harry and Hermione, I reckon I can trust them with just about anything. We've been through a lot together, and they've never let me down. Even when I've felt jealous or unsure, deep down, I know I can rely on them. And they trust me too, even though I might mess up sometimes. It's all about being there for each other, no matter what. That's what true loyalty means, isn't it?

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm lazy all the time, but there have been moments where I've let things slide, especially when homework piles up. But when it comes down to it, I always find the strength to stand up for my mates and do what needs to be done. Whether it's facing off against Umbridge or helping out in dangerous Auror missions, I reckon that's when I shine the most. And yeah, sometimes I do need a bit of prodding from Hermione to get going, but that's part of being in a team, isn't it? You look out for each other and make sure everyone's pulling their weight.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm always emotionally rock solid, mate. There've been times when things got pretty heavy, and I felt like I was going to crack under the pressure. But when it comes down to it, I reckon my friends know they can count on me. Even if I get a bit jittery now and then, I've learned to push through it, especially when we're in the thick of some dangerous situation. At the end of the day, I'd do just about anything to keep Harry and Hermione safe, and I think that counts for something, doesn't it?

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm the most inventive bloke around, but I've come up with a thing or two when it really mattered. Like that time with the Canary Creams, watching some kid's invention bring a spark to my dad's shop – that was pretty cool. And then there was the whole business with the eerie banquet platter, trying to connect with the ghosts. It didn't turn out exactly like we hoped, but hey, we tried, right? Sometimes it's just about giving it a shot and seeing what happens, especially when it comes to stuff with George. We're always coming up with new ways to prank and help folks, even if it's not the most polished idea. In the end, it's about having a bit of hope and fun in what we do.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Well, you could say I'm not exactly the first one to stand up and shout my thoughts to the whole room. I usually let Harry and Hermione take the lead because they’re pretty amazing at it. But when it comes down to it, and there’s something important at stake, like protecting my friends or fighting for what’s right, I’ll definitely speak up. Sometimes, I wish people saw me as more than just a sidekick, ya know? And in those quieter moments, I might exaggerate a little to get some recognition, but really, my biggest assertiveness comes from doing what I think is right, even if it means stepping out of my comfort zone.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Cold and aloof? Nah, that's not really my style. I mean, sure, there’ve been times when things got a bit heavy and I wasn't at my best, like when Hermione was all buddy-buddy with Harry and I felt a bit left out. But even then, I just wanna prove myself and make things better with my friends. And when it comes down to it, I’m all about being there for them, no matter what. I reckon keeping things light and cracking jokes helps me deal with the pressure, even if it means I'm not always the calmest one around. But yeah, cold and aloof? Not likely, mate. That’d be more like Malfoy’s game.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Yeah, I do. When it comes down to it, and especially when it's something that matters to my friends, I'll stick around no matter how messy things get. Sometimes it's hard, I mean, there've been times I doubted myself, like planning that break into Gringotts or becoming an Auror after school. But in the end, I know that pushing through, even when it feels like the whole world's against you, is what it's all about. It's not just about magic or spells—it's about being there for each other and believing in the good we can do. That's what really makes the difference, isn't it?

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Yeah, I can definitely be moody, especially when things don’t go my way. Like, you remember that time when Hermione was all cozy with Harry and I felt a bit left out? Or when she didn’t tell me about the Time-Turner? Those were pretty low moments. But you know, it’s not just about being down in the dumps—I get really fired up too, like when we were saving Buckbeak. It’s kind of a mixed bag, really. One minute I’m all mopey, and the next I’m ready to stand up for my friends no matter what. And let’s not forget that time I got stuck in the fireplace trying to help Harry! Just another example of how unpredictable I can be. But hey, at least it shows I care, right?

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do appreciate a bit of artistry here and there. Like, remember that time at Bill and Fleur’s wedding? There was something magical about seeing all the beauty and the spells creating that fantastic atmosphere. It was a bit overwhelming, but also really amazing. And even though I didn’t get on too well with Divination and History o' Magic, there's definitely something special 'bout the way magic can make everything look so enchanting and full of wonder. Guess you could say it's not my strong suit, but I do enjoy when others bring that kind of flair to our adventures.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Yeah, I can be pretty shy and inhibited, especially when things get really serious. But around my mates, like Harry and Hermione, I try to be myself. It's just that sometimes, you know, all the stuff we've been through, it hits me hard. I worry a lot, especially about my family and what's going on with Harry. But at the end of the day, I know I gotta step up and show some courage, even if my legs feel like jelly most of the time.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I try to be kind and considerate, especially when it counts most. Like when I stood up for Fleur, even though my own mum wasn't too thrilled about her marrying Bill. And yeah, I can get a bit impulsive and maybe not always say the right thing, but at the end of the day, I care about my mates and I'd do anything to help them out. Take Harry, for instance; I had to go fetch him from that blasted Dursley place even if it meant getting stuck in a fireplace and causing a bit of a mess. That's just what friends do, right? So yeah, I guess you could say I'm pretty decent when it comes to folks I care about, and I try not to let my grouchiness get in the way too much.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: Well, efficient isn't always my strong point. I mean, sometimes I just charge in without really thinking about the best way to get something done, right? But when it comes down to it, especially in a tight spot, I can pull off some pretty clever tricks. Like dodging curses during the Calamity or helping out with defensive footwork at the Auror office. I might not have Hermione's brains or Harry's knack for getting everything right the first time, but I've got my moments where I manage to be quite useful. And hey, even if I'm not exactly efficient, I've got a good heart and a lot of determination—I'll keep trying until I get it right.

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Well, I don't reckon I'm the calmest bloke in the room when things get tense, but that's just because I care so much about my mates and what's right. When it comes down to it, I'll stand firm and do what needs to be done, even if I'm quaking inside. It's the fear mixed with loyalty that keeps me going, I guess. I've found that in the thick of it, you can't just sit back and let others handle the danger, especially when it's your friends who are in trouble. So yeah, I might not be calm, but I sure am ready to face whatever comes our way to keep everyone safe.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine work? Nah, doesn't really do it for me. I mean, sure, there's a certain comfort in knowing what's coming next, but where's the adventure in that? I've always been the type to thrive on the unexpected, whether it's dodging spells or figuring out how to help my mates. It's all about being ready for whatever comes your way, right? That's the sort of thing that keeps life interesting and gives you a chance to prove yourself. Plus, without a bit of unpredictability, how else would I get to show off my chess skills or distract Dolores Umbridge when Harry needed me most? Routine just isn't my cup of tea—I'd rather be on my feet, ready to tackle something new.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty outgoing when I'm with my mates. There's nothing like a good laugh and some banter to make me feel right at home. But when it comes to strangers or big crowds, I might just blend into the background a bit. It's not like I'm shy or anything—I just prefer the company of those I know and trust, you know? And let's face it, sometimes I can get a bit too excited, especially with something like Quidditch or a good game of Wizard's Chess, which might come off as being overly sociable. But hey, that's just the way I am—I'm all about having a good time and sharing it with others.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Well, I reckon everyone can be a bit rude sometimes, especially when things get tense or when you’re feeling jealous or worried. Take that time with Hermione and Harry, for example—sometimes I’d say stuff out of jealousy or frustration. But at the end of the day, it’s all about being there for your mates, isn’t it? That’s why I always try to make things right and stand up for what’s right, even if I slip up every now and then.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Well, I reckon plans are all well and good, but sometimes things just happen, y'know? Like when me and Hermione went to get sweets for Harry in Hogsmeade. We didn't have no grand plan, just wanted to do something nice for our mate. And then there was the time we tried to get Slughorn's memory, that was pretty risky but it worked out alright in the end. The thing is, following through ain't always about the plan; it's about being there for your friends and doing what needs to be done, even if it feels like you're walking into a storm. That's what keeps us going, really—just sticking together and hoping for the best.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Yeah, I do get nervous easily—I mean, who wouldn't with all the stuff we've been through? But when it comes down to it, my friends and I, we just try to push through it together. There've been times when fear almost got the better of me, like when I saw Sirius Black with a knife, or when we had to deal with those Dementors. But in the end, it's the thought of losing the people I care about that makes me face my fears head-on, even if it means going into a forest full of giant spiders. That's what friends are for, right? To help each other through the tough times.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Well, I reckon there's nothing quite like a good laugh with the lads or a bit of Quidditch to clear the mind. But honestly, I'm more of a "act first, think later" kind of guy. The idea of sitting around reflecting and playing with thoughts isn't really my cup of tea. I mean, sure, I've got my moments—like when I was clutched onto that Deluminator, thinking about Fred and George's jokes and how we always found our way through thick and thin—but generally, I prefer to get stuck into things headfirst. That's what makes me feel alive, ya know? Plus, having mates like Harry and Hermione around to help sort out the mess afterwards is pretty handy.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Well, I've always been more of a guy who's got his hands in potions or broomsticks rather than paintbrushes or music. I mean, sure, I reckon the twins' jokes and pranks need a bit of creativity and I admire that, but as for me, I just don't have that kind of patience. Give me a good Quidditch match or a laugh with mates any day over sitting still trying to paint a picture or something. But hey, I'm not saying there isn't a bit of artistry in dodging curses and coming up with plans to outsmart the bad guys, right?

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon cooperation's pretty important. Can't do everything on your own, especially when it comes to facing dark stuff or just having a good time. Like when me and Harry went to get that memory from Slughorn, we needed to work together to pull it off. And even though I've had my fair share of doubts and moments where I felt like I wasn't up to snuff, being with mates always makes things better. Whether it's a Quidditch match or a battle against dark wizards, it's easier and way more fun with friends around. Plus, who wouldn't want some extra help when trying to make bizarre treats for ghosts?

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can get a bit distracted, especially when there's chess or a good game of Exploding Snap involved. But when it comes to my friends and what really matters, like saving Buckbeak or getting through some dangerous situation, I focus pretty well. I mean, you gotta stay sharp in times like those, right? And hey, sometimes being a bit scatterbrained helps come up with crazy ideas that just might work, like trying to make a platter for ghosts at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. So, maybe getting distracted isn't all bad. It depends on what's going on, really.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm exactly sophisticated when it comes to art, music, or literature. I mean, I've got more important things to think about, like how to hex Malfoy next time I see him or figuring out the best way to avoid attacks when we're out on some mad adventure. But hey, every now and then, I do find myself listening to those Muggle bands Hermione likes, if only to try and understand her a bit better. And if there's any book that catches my eye, it's probably one that helps us figure out how to beat You-Know-Who, rather than some fancy poetry or whatever. So yeah, you could say I'm pretty practical about these things, mate. Hope that answers your question!
